page.title: 05BLOSSOM IN GOXHILL.
page.content:
The approaches to the village are famous for their flowering cherry trees which are in blossom in late May. Thornton Road is lined on each side with white flowering trees whilst the trees lining Ferry Road are alternately white and pink blossomed. All these trees are mature and hence for the short time that they are in flower the approaches to Goxhill are very picturesque. The ground beheath the trees becomes a carpet of white as the blossom falls.
An avenue of elm trees lined Barrow Road from the parish boundary to the outskirts of the village but these, and those in Gatehouse Road, were felled in 1984 when they were ravaged by Dutch Elm Disease.
